page.title: 04SANDING IN KNUTSFORD
page.content: This tradition of sanding has been going on for over 900 years. It is believed that King Canute(1013-1045) started the tradition. Since then it has been passed down from father to son. Ted Worrall is the last we know of who has passed it down to the present team. The people who do it now are Jimmy and Alfred Gilbert, Ray Keat and Colin Veal. We hope that it will be passed down and carried on by the next generation. Each year the sand is coloured with dye which is dry powder. They have about six different colours of sand (red, yellow, orange, white, blue and purple). They have lots of different patterns and sometimes make up new ones. The time of year they do the sanding is on May Day but they also do it at weddings.
